definition: to break the law/to commit a crime
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: Forgiving the perpetrator for his action does not mean you stop judging the deed.
sentences.chinese: 原谅犯事者并不代表你已经停止裁定这件事。

sentences.english: Xinhua says offenders should be sternly punished.
sentences.chinese: 新华社说，犯事者应该严惩。

sentences.english: You were working at the school and I often managed to get sent outside class for something.
sentences.chinese: 你在学校里工作，而我竟然常常因为犯事被赶出教室。

sentences.english: Don’t do that again, it said. And he didn’t.
sentences.chinese: 它告诉儿子不要再犯事儿了，而他确实没有。

sentences.english: If the suspect really didn't do it, why didn't the suspect immediately say that to the arresting officer?
sentences.chinese: 要是嫌犯真的没有犯事，为什么不马上给警官说？

sentences.english: Rise to meet right bridge, and will establish guangxi overall told him to get the truth.
sentences.chinese: 上升与正桥会面，并将立桂犯事的真相全盘告诉他。

definition: to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
to commit a crime or offence
